abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Irrigation Subsector II (O&M)
            Project in Indonesia. The objectives of the project were to
            continue: (a) strengthening cost recovery, encouraging
            efficient use of water resources, and supporting the
            turnover of small public irrigation schemes to water
            users' associations (WUAs); (b) supporting
            institutional development; and (c) improving the physical,
            programming, budgeting and institutional aspects of O&M,
            so that the effectiveness of existing systems could be
            sustained. Bank’s performance was satisfactory. The Borrower
            has generally performed satisfactorily. The key lessons
            learned were as follows (a) good performance would be
            achieved more efficiently if the institutional structure
            under the Bupati and the process and procedures for
            implementing the Irrigation Service Fee (ISF) program were
            reviewed and strengthened; (ii) most construction quality
            deficiencies are due to lack of compliance with existing
            construction specifications and standards; there is a need
            to establish accountability; (iii) expensive groundwater
            development is unlikely to be economically viable if it is
            used to irrigate low value crops with low cropping
            intensity; and (iv) efficient water allocation to improve
            water resources management requires an effective long-term
            institutional arrangement.
